intro: Melanthera oxylepis, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in terminal spikes, typical of the Onagraceae family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in woodland edges and wetlands. Melanthera oxylepis is not typically cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and morphological features.
